organizations: New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association
lead_paragraph: The initial sampling of New Jersey’s tests for steroid abuse by high school athletes found no positive results, the group administering the tests reported. There was no evidence of performance-enhancing drugs among the 150 random samples from tournament-bound high school athletes, according to Bob Baly, the assistant director of the New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association. The association said it planned to test about 500 athletes in the 2006-7 school year. A student who fails a test will be suspended from competition for a year and will receive counseling.
